description: From French édition, from Latin ēditiō, from ēdere (“to publish”).

entries.meaning: (publishing) A written work edited and published, as by a certain editor or in a certain manner, or at a certain time.
examples: She wanted a copy of the Clericotes edition, but had to settle for the 1921 edition.  She had never liked abridged editions.

entries.meaning: The whole number of copies of a work printed and published at one time.
examples: The first edition was soon sold.
What he had found was a particularly valuable first edition.

entries.meaning: (sports) A particular instance of an event.
examples: The 2014 edition of the Tour de France started in Leeds, Yorkshire.
